chargeHist.descr: Terrorist Threats - Public Panic or Fear

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall comply with all of the terms of bond, which continues to remain in effect during the period of this agreement. Defendant must successfully complete the probationary period ordered in count 2 and all required conditions of probation.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss the charge.

charges.descr: Terrorist Threats - Public Panic or Fear

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $30.00 a month beginning June 22, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to Sierra Pacific due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William G. Ploeger

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

11:30 AM Defendant William G. Ploeger in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to an attorney.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2.  Court makes a finding of guilt on count 1. Statement by Attorney Tlusty.   Count 1 - court defers entry of judgment for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the charge will be dismissed.  Count 2 - Court orders a withheld sentence and placed on probation for a period of one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to Sierra Pacific due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation; AODA and follow through with all treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  There is five days of sentence credit.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $30.00 a month beginning June 22, 2022.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:34 PM Defendant William G. Ploeger in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim notification has been complied.  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to an attorney.  Court questions defendant regarding waiving a preliminary hearing. Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Attorney Tlusty will be filing an Information.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm. - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:20 PM Defendant William G. Ploeger in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied.  Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney. Defendant will be contacting the public defender's office.  Defendant waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm. - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant shall not enter the premises of Sierra Pacific.  Defendant shall not posess any firearms.
Initial Appearance set February 15, 2022 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Smith appeared specially by audio and video through Zoom for the defendant William Ploeger.  William G. Ploeger appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Victim notification has been complied.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $5,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession of firearms and no entering the premises of Sierra Pacific.  Statement by Attorney Smith.  Court orders a $4,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession of firearms and no enter the premises of Sierra Pacific.  Defendant advised of his right to an attorney and notice was given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
